title: Medical Definition of Traditional Chinese medicine
author: Medical Editor Melissa Conrad Stöppler; MD
description: Read medical definition of Traditional Chinese medicine
cleaned_text: Traditional Chinese medicine: The current name for an ancient system of [health](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=3663) care from China. [Traditional Chinese medicine](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=33520) ( [TCM](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=33521)) is based on a concept of balanced qi (pronounced "chee"), or [vital](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=6001) energy, that is believed to flow throughout the body. Qi is proposed to regulate a person's spiritual, emotional, mental, and physical [balance](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=10760) and to be influenced by the opposing forces of yin (negative energy) and yang (positive energy). [Disease](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=3011) is proposed to result from the flow of qi being disrupted and yin and yang becoming imbalanced. Among the components of TCM are [herbal](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=31351) and nutritional [therapy](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=10897), restorative physical exercises, [meditation](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=10807), acupuncture, and remedial massage.
